meanings.definition: To edit a written work for errors in grammar, punctuation, and style.
meanings.sent1: She copyedited her essay to fix any mistakes before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The editor copyedited the manuscript to ensure it was error-free.
meanings.sent3: The student copyedited her friend's letter as a favor, finding and correcting errors.
meanings.sent4: The teacher copyedited the students' essays with a keen eye for detail.
meanings.sent5: He copyedited the report meticulously, making sure every comma was in its place.

meanings.definition: The act of reviewing and correcting a document for accuracy and consistency.
meanings.sent1: The copyedited version of the article was ready for publication.
meanings.sent2: She received the copyedited manuscript back from the editor with corrections.
meanings.sent3: The copyedited document was so neat and tidy that it impressed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The copyedited report was a shining example of attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: He appreciated the copyedited copy for its clarity and precision.
